channel.title: Wheeler on Wheeler Genealogy
channel.description: Recent content in Wheeler on Wheeler Genealogy

item.title: Wheeler Weekly: The Deputy Sheriff Question (and What I Still Need to Prove)
item.description: Two cataloged legal documents name a Deputy Sheriff Solomon Wheeler during the Revolutionary era. I’ve completed my SAR supplemental application using Solomon’s lineage—now the work is proving the Deputy Sheriff is my 4th great grandfather.

item.title: Finallly A Wheeler
item.description: A long-running Wheeler question: did my 4th great-grandfather Solomon Wheeler support the American Revolution through civil service? New evidence points to civil law enforcement activity in 1777 New Hampshire that may connect to my Solomon.

item.title: Carra Inez (Tuttle) Wheeler: Vermont Roots, Connecticut Years, Holyoke Home
item.description: Born in Windsor County, Vermont, Carra Inez Tuttle married John Edward Wheeler and raised a family through Connecticut before returning to Holyoke, Massachusetts.

item.title: From Cranfield, Bedfordshire to New England: A Wheeler Family Story
item.description: A Bedfordshire Wheeler family appears in early New England records, planting roots in Connecticut and Massachusetts through the 1600s.

item.title: The Wheeler Crest (Bedfordshire): What We Know and What We’re Still Confirming
item.description: A quick note on the Wheeler crest associated with Bedfordshire, why we’re using it on the site, and the evidence questions still open.

item.title: Willard Wheeler (52 Ancestors, #12, Willard Wheeler)
item.description: One of my first brick walls was that of my 2nd great-grandfather, Willard Wheeler. Willard Wheeler was born 18 August 1820 in Westmoreland, Cheshire, New Hampshire. Willard had a twin brother, William. Willard and William were the sons of Barnard Wheeler (b. 06 Dec 1788; d. abt. Jul 1836) and Susanna Pierce (b. 25 Mar 1787; d. unknown). Willard lived with his parents on 12 siblings in Swanzey, New Hampshire.

item.title: Willard Wheeler (52 Ancestors, #12, Willard Wheeler)
item.description: One of my first brick walls was that of my 2nd great-grandfather, Willard Wheeler. Willard Wheeler was born 18 August 1820 in Westmoreland, Cheshire, New Hampshire. Willard had a twin brother, William. Willard and William were the sons of Barnard Wheeler (b. 06 Dec 1788; d. abt. Jul 1836) and Susanna Pierce (b. 25 Mar 1787; d. unknown). Willard lived with his parents on 12 siblings in Swanzey, New Hampshire.

item.title: Howard Robinson Wheeler (52 Ancestors, #9 Howard Wheeler)
item.description: Howard Robinson Wheeler was born 05 Jun 1894 in Derby, Connecticut. Howard was the son of John Edward Wheeler and Carra Inez Tuttle. While born in Derby, Connecticut, Howard was raised in Holyoke, Massachusetts. Howard lived in Holyoke until his 23rd birthday when he joined the Army. Recruited from Holyoke, Massachusetts, Howard served in the Army from 22 Jun 1917 to 13 Mar 1919. During his time in the Army in the Medical Detachment, 70th Acty, C.A.C., Howard attained the rank of sergeant. Upon completion of his two year commitment to the Army, Howard returned to Holyoke.

item.title: Howard Robinson Wheeler (52 Ancestors, #9 Howard Wheeler)
item.description: Howard Robinson Wheeler was born 05 Jun 1894 in Derby, Connecticut. Howard was the son of John Edward Wheeler and Carra Inez Tuttle. While born in Derby, Connecticut, Howard was raised in Holyoke, Massachusetts. Howard lived in Holyoke until his 23rd birthday when he joined the Army. Recruited from Holyoke, Massachusetts, Howard served in the Army from 22 Jun 1917 to 13 Mar 1919. During his time in the Army in the Medical Detachment, 70th Acty, C.A.C., Howard attained the rank of sergeant. Upon completion of his two year commitment to the Army, Howard returned to Holyoke.

item.title: Carra Inez Tuttle (52 Ancestors; #6 Carra Inez Tuttle
item.description: As I have stated previously, I am fortunate enough to be surrounded by photos of my ancestors. One such ancestor that I was introduced to at a relatively young age due to photos in our home was my great grandmother, Carra Inez (nee Tuttle) Wheeler. Carra Inez Tuttle was born 27 Jul 1856 in Cavendish, Vermont to Augustus Tuttle and Elsie Robinson. While Carra was born in Cavendish, Vermont we find that Carra and her family were in Holyoke, Massachusetts by 1863 where Carra’s father owned a store.

item.title: Carra Inez Tuttle (52 Ancestors; #6 Carra Inez Tuttle
item.description: As I have stated previously, I am fortunate enough to be surrounded by photos of my ancestors. Carra Inez Tuttle was born 27 Jul 1856 in Cavendish, Vermont to Augustus Tuttle and Elsie Robinson. While Carra was born in Cavendish, Vermont we find that Carra and her family were in Holyoke, Massachusetts by 1863 where Carra’s father owned a store.

item.title: Sylvester Beasecker (52 Ancestors: #2 Sylvester B. Beasecker)
item.description: While we are talking about the Beaseckers, lets talk about one of the more interesting men in my family tree based upon what I have found out about him. Sylvester B. Beasecker was born 06 Feb 1859 in Goshen, Elkhart, Indiana. Sylvester is the son of Samuel Beasecker and Martha Ann Bowman. Over the course of his life, Sylvester had four (4) wives, owned several businesses and lived in several different states to include Illinois, Indiana, Minnesota and Georgia.
